IFWUnknown Interface Reference
[Common Interfaces]

import "common.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IFWUnknown:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The FreeWill+ hierarchy root class.

All other interfaces MUST INHERIT from this.
See Using the Standard Base Interfaces

Definition at line 513 of file common.idl.

Public Member Functions

Access to the FWDevice
The functions in this group are to make the IFWDevice object available from everywhere in the system

HRESULT GetFWDevice ([out, retval] IFWDevice **)
 Gets the FreeWill+ Device object.

HRESULT PutFWDevice (IFWDevice *)
 Sets the FreeWill+ Device object: Attention: for internal use only, never call, use IFWDevice::RegisterObject instead.

IFWDevice * FWDevice ()
 Quick access to the FreeWill+ Device: does not call AddRef, so don't use Release on the result!

Cloning
These simple functions create an unitialised object of the same class and thus enable objects to be used as class factories

HRESULT GetClone (REFIID iid,[out, retval, iid_is(iid)] IFWUnknown **p)
 Produces a Clone - object of the same class and reveals a pointer to the specified interface.

IFWUnknown * Clone (REFIID iid)
 Produces a Clone - object of the same class, a short form of GetClone.

Object Initialisation
The functions in this group are called exclusively by the System Repository when an object is created.

QueryFitness is called only when there is more than one class registered for the given Noun/Verb pair. Create is called only from the repository; it will not be called when an object is cloned.

See also:
Object Creation Insight


HRESULT QueryFitness (IFWCreateContext *,[out, retval] FWFLOAT *pfFitness)
 Queries the object about how well it is fitted to perform a given task (more).

HRESULT Create (IFWCreateContext *)
 Called just after the object is created to allow for class-specific initialisation (more).

HRESULT GetRTCId ([out, retval] FWULONG *)

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IFWUnknown::QueryFitness (  IFWCreateContext *  ,
[out, retval] FWFLOAT *  pfFitness
) 
 

Queries the object about how well it is fitted to perform a given task (more).

This function is called exclusively from within the system repository. This function is called only in case of more than one class is registered for the given Noun+Verb pair. The call gives the class a chance to affect resolving this ambiguity. The function is called on behalf of the factory object, before actually creating a new one, and thus it should refrain from any initialisation stuff and should keep the object internal state.

See also:
Object Creation Insight

HRESULT IFWUnknown::Create (  IFWCreateContext *   ) 
 

Called just after the object is created to allow for class-specific initialisation (more).

Call back the IFWCreateContext member functions to get the details of the creation process. Call IFWCreateContext::EnumParams to create an IFWEnumParams object and access the creation parameters provided by the calling client.

See also:
Object Creation Insight

HRESULT IFWUnknown::Error (  HRESULT  nErrorCode,
FWULONG  nParams,
[size_is(nParams)] FWULONG *  pParams,
FWSTRING  pMessage,
FWULONG  nSeverity
) 
 

This function should be called each time an error condition occurrs! (details).

The Error Code is the essential parameter you have to pass, and may be any of the following:

  • One of the Common Error Codes (FW_ERROR_CODES). The error message & severity level is then supplied automatically.
  • A class-specific error code. The error message & severity level. must be supplied by the class, see IFWUnknown::GetClassError.
  • COM system HRESULT value (not recommended), the error message is supplied by the system

You will often call this function with the default values of all the other params, like 

 Error(YOUR_ERROR_CODE, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
See also:
Error Handling
Parameters:
nErrorCode - The Error Code (see above)
nParams,pParams - An array of parameters to be used to format the error message
pMessage - Pass a value here to override the default error message
nSeverity - Pass a value here to override the default severity code; you may use FW_SEV_SET_ATLEAST/ATMOST flags
Returns:
The HRESULT nErrorCode, which may be returned by the caller function as the error result.
Remarks:
This is a convenience function that calls IFWDevice::RaiseError function.

See ErrorSrc for extended source file/line no information

HRESULT IFWUnknown::ErrorSrc (  FWSTRING  pSrcFile,
FWULONG  nSrcLine
) 
 

Called just before Error, this function may submit information on error source file & line number; see details.

You can facilitate the use of this function using the following macro: 

            #define ERROR ErrorSrc(L##__FILE__, __LINE__), Error
            // then raise errors in your code in this way:
            return ERROR(YOUR_ERROR_CODE, 0, NULL, NULL, 0);
Remarks:
This is a convenience function that calls IFWDevice::RaiseErrorSrc function.

HRESULT IFWUnknown::GetClassError (  FWULONG  nCode,
FWULONG  nParams,
[size_is(nParams)] FWULONG *  pParams,
[out] FWSTRING *  pMessage,
[out] FWULONG *  pSeverity
) 
 

Provides the description of the class-specific errors to the system (details).

This function should be implmented in all classes that raise own class-specific errors and it is called by IFWUnknown::Error / IFWDevice::RaiseError each time such an error is reported.

Parameters:
nCode the class-specific error code
nParams,pParams array of parameters for message construction: 0, NULL if none
Return values:
pMessage the error message
pSeverity the error default severity code
See also:
IFWUnknown::Error, IFWDevice::RaiseError, Error Handling
